transcript.sentence: As kaoline walks away from the viewer, a needle like hand appears on screen, begins to follow her.
As the hand sneaks around rocks behind coraline, she opens the gate to a hole in the ground.
After coraline reaches for a key hanging around her neck, the hand quickly moves towards her and grabs the key, pulling her to the ground.
Viewers perspective quickly speeds towards the house, showing a door with a glowing light behind.
A bright light appears uphill.
The source of the light is revealed to be a boy on a motorcycle wearing a mask, who rides downhill and captures the hand,
freeing coraline.
The hand begins to attack the boy pulling off his mask and revealing that he is y p
y b is knocked off of his motorcycle and falls into the hole hanging on the edge.
The hand attempts to make y b fall on the whole, but coraline jumps on Top of it with a blanket and captures it.
The hand easily escapes. But before attacking coraline, a rock falls on Top of it, dropped by y p.
Cauline reps, the key rock
crushed hand and blanket together.
Together that you pick up the bundle and toss it into the hole.
They returned the gate back to its original place on Top of the hall.
The scene ends and enters a movie clips dot com title screen.

audio_descriptions.notes: The hand begins to attack the boy, pulling off his mask and revealing that he is Wybie. Wybie is knocked off of his motorcycle and falls into the hole, hanging on the edge.

Coraline walks through the cold, dark night. slowly, a hand made up of needles follows behind

she grabs a stick and uses it to pry open a hole in the ground 
and the hand is hiding behind the rocks as she reaches for a rope with the key around her neck

as she reaches, it jumps and grabs it, then drags her across the ground, to the direction of the house.

a flash of light appears, Coraline's friend Wybie is seen in a skeleton mask with three green lenses drives down on a motorcycle. He drives by and grabs the hand with a pair of tongs, and coraline is free

He drives away in the distance

the hand escapes their grip and jumps onto his mask, blocking his vision. the motorcycle is still in motion until it hits a rock and Wybie flies into the open hole in the ground

he clutches onto the sides as the hand tries to loosen his grip off the edge.

result.title: Coraline (10/10) Movie CLIP - The Creepy Hand (2009) HD
result.description:
Coraline movie clips: http://j.mp/1uyjyyf
BUY THE MOVIE: http://amzn.to/v8PRRx
Don't miss the HOTTEST NEW TRAILERS: http://bit.ly/1u2y6pr

CLIP DESCRIPTION:
Coraline (Dakota Fanning) and Wybie (Robert Bailey Jr.) get strong-armed by the Other Mother's pesky severed hand.

FILM DESCRIPTION:
A young girl walks through a secret door and discovers a parallel reality that is eerily similar to the life she already knows, yet deeply unsettling in a number of ways, in director Henry Selick's animated adaptation of Neil Gaiman's international best-seller. Eleven-year-old Coraline Jones (voice of Dakota Fanning) is fearlessly courageous, and perhaps far too adventurous for her own good. Coraline and her parents (Teri Hatcher and John Hodgman) have recently relocated to Oregon from Michigan. Bored in her new home since her parents are distracted by work and she has yet to make any new friends, Coraline passes the time by exploring her new neighborhood with an annoying local boy named Wybie Lovat (Robert Bailey Jr.). But after paying a visit to her eccentric neighbors Miss Spink (Jennifer Saunders) and Miss Forcible (Dawn French), a pair of aging British actresses, and crossing paths with the outright weird Mr. Bobinsky (Ian McShane), the precocious young girl becomes convinced that her new surroundings are just as dull as she'd initially suspected. Shortly thereafter, Coraline discovers a hidden door in her new house, and decides to investigate. Venturing into the eerie passageway inside, Coraline emerges into an alternate version of her own reality. At first glance, this strange new world seems even better than the real thing; there her parents aren't distracted by work, and Coraline is always the center of attention. There's even a mysterious Cat (Keith David) that's fascinated by her every move. But when Coraline's button-eyed Other Mother (also Hatcher) attempts to make her stay permanent, the frightened young girl must summon her resourcefulness and bravery in order to find her way back home and save her real family.

CREDITS:
TM & © Universal (2009)
Cast: Robert Bailey Jr., Dakota Fanning
Director: Henry Selick
Producers: Bill Mechanic, Henry Selick, Michael Zoumas, Claire Jennings, Mary Sandell
Screenwriters: Neil Gaiman, Henry Selick
